net.zerobandwidth.android.lib.services

Interface SingletonServiceInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SingletonService, SingletonService.Connection

    public interface SingletonServiceInterface
    Defines the public API of the SingletonService class. This interface is defined separately because the inner SingletonService.Connection class also provides it; comments about the methods of the interface can thus be defined and shared by all implementations.
    Since:
    zerobandwidth-net/android 0.0.1 (#1)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <T> T get(java.lang.Class<T> cls)
      Returns the singleton instance of the specified class.
      <T> T getOrPut(java.lang.Class<T> cls, T oFallback)
      Gets the current singleton instance for the specified class, or stores the supplied alternative as the singleton if none was previously set.
      <T> boolean hasInstanceFor(java.lang.Class<T> cls)
      Indicates whether a singleton instance has been set for the specified class.
      <T> T put(java.lang.Class<T> cls, T oInstance)
      Specifies the singleton instance of a given class.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        <T> T get(java.lang.Class<T> cls)
        Returns the singleton instance of the specified class. If no singleton has been created yet, then null is returned. If a casting error occurs internally, then the method returns null but also logs a warning.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the class for which a singleton should be returned
        Parameters:
        cls - the class for which a singleton should be returned
        Returns:
        the singleton instance of the class, or null if none can be obtained

      • put

        <T> T put(java.lang.Class<T> cls,
          T oInstance)
        Specifies the singleton instance of a given class. If no previous singleton has been set, then null is returned. If a casting error occurs internally while trying to pass back the previous instance, then null is still returned, but an error is also written to the logs.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the class for which a singleton should be set
        Parameters:
        cls - the class for which a singleton should be set
        oInstance - the instance to be proclaimed as the singleton instance
        Returns:
        any previously-set singleton instance for that class, or null if none can be obtained

      • getOrPut

        <T> T getOrPut(java.lang.Class<T> cls,
               T oFallback)
        Gets the current singleton instance for the specified class, or stores the supplied alternative as the singleton if none was previously set.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the class for which a singleton should be returned
        Parameters:
        cls - the class for which a singleton should be returned
        oFallback - an instance to set if no previous instance is found
        Returns:
        the singleton instance of the class, or the supplied alternative if none can be obtained

      • hasInstanceFor

        <T> boolean hasInstanceFor(java.lang.Class<T> cls)
        Indicates whether a singleton instance has been set for the specified class.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the class for which a singleton might be set
        Parameters:
        cls - the class for which a singleton might be set
        Returns:
        true if an instance has been set for the class
